column4: Hello everyone. I was looking for a little advice on installing Ubuntu on an IDE Flash Module, and sizings and such
Well, I want to install Ubuntu on an IDE Flash module, but I need to buy one that is an appropriate size. I will be booting from the IDE Flash Module and storing data on a HDD.

The thing I'm wondering is, I want to buy the smallest one possible, as they're expensive! If I could install it on a 1GB one that'd be great, but I can't find any info on what is a suitable size for installation
i just did a clean install in a vm of ubuntu 9.10. will check its size
Would there be a way to cut that down to, say, 2GB?
you would have to create an custom install using the server-installation cd
I tried Xubuntu, it seemed unreliable; I think it has something to do with VIA chipsets, or maybe I installed it wrong ;)
the installcd creates an 2,6 gb installation. nothing you can do about that without doing a custom installation
Either way, after a weekend of messing around, I installed plain Ubuntu and everything worked great, so I don't really fancy the Xubuntu experience again just yet.
Is there a guide or at least a starter on the web for how to do a custom installation?
